110 Agreements

March 11, 2013
Part 110-refers to the process set forth in 10 Code of Federal Regulations Part 110, establishing licensing requirements for any person that seeks to import or export NRC-controlled nuclear equipment or material. Part 110 applies export restrictions, but are not limited to, the following: Nuclear production and utilization facilities (e.g., reactors, fuel cycle facilities) and especially designed or prepared equipment/components for such facilities Special nuclear material Source material Byproduct material Deuterium and heavy water Nuclear grade graphite for nuclear end use Consulting with the NRC is the best way to determine if you need a Part 110 export license. See the NRC website for more information. Additional Resources Licensing process summary Step-by-step to the licensing process
